post_message: This 12-year-old boy — with no books and no money to get to the library — wanted to read so badly, he read junk mail. That was until his postman and the Internet stepped up to get him some books.

commenter_b: The same thing happened to me! A few neighbors found it funny to toss their firecrackers over the fence during some lunch party. We came home to find our poor baby scratched up and shaking - stuck between a rose bush and fence. Horrible horrible how lightly some people take this!
commenter_a: I used to love July 4th until someone decided to throw firecrackers in the yard with my dog. She passed her fears on and my dogs are so afraid they huddle against me and shake. I dare not leave my home out of concern for what my pets go through.
post_message: URGENT: Your dogs & cats can be TERRIFIED of fireworks. Keep them safe this #FourthOfJuly.
